intro: Oxytropis densiflora var. densiflora, commonly known as denseflower locoweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, fluffy clusters of small, pea-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small, stiff leaflets and produces elongated, twisted seed pods. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert habitats. Oxytropis densiflora var. densiflora is adapted to arid environments and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules.
